channel.title: 667 RsPs Server Help (Please Reply!)
channel.description:
I downloaded the "Poanizer" Project source and client. It's an amazing client and I really enjoy it.
I've made myself owner on the server, I've changed a couple of customs and added a few, but the only issue is
I CAN'T FIND OUT HOW TO SET MY STATS.
667 Character files are anti-leech files, making it so people can't make themselves owner (unless you are the true owner of the server).
I've looked everywhere and I can't find out how to change my stats to 99's (for obvious reasons, I'm the owner.)
If you have any information on how you can help or what-not, please reply to this forum post or message me on skype @ dylan.burns.96155
Thanks!

item.title: 667 RsPs Server Help (Please Reply!)
item.dc:creator: @malimt malimt
item.description:
@malimt wrote:

[quote=“PrivateDamn, post:1, topic:550698”]I downloaded the “Poanizer” Project source and client. It’s an amazing client and I really enjoy it.

I’ve made myself owner on the server, I’ve changed a couple of customs and added a few, but the only issue is

I CAN’T FIND OUT HOW TO SET MY STATS.

667 Character files are anti-leech files, making it so people can’t make themselves owner (unless you are the true owner of the server).

I’ve looked everywhere and I can’t find out how to change my stats to 99’s (for obvious reasons, I’m the owner.)

If you have any information on how you can help or what-not, please reply to this forum post or message me on skype @ dylan.burns.96155

Thanks![/quote]
WOW… Why would you even go there, if you don’t have even a clue on how to do anything. In every server you have (Master) 600+ Servers characters are encrypted… therefore, if you open the charac’s files, you won’t really be able to view anything…
Study up on it, then start.
Go to " Commands.java " THen, search for " master " or " god " Then it should be there and if not, it’s very simple to create a command, many tutorials are avil here.

Read full topic

Thanks![/quote]just make a command that sets your stats to 99

there is probably a command ;;master or something along those lines already inside the source

Read full topic
